summary: A formal Touhy request letter from the law firm Edwards Pottinger LLC to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, seeking documentary evidence related to a victim of Jeffrey Epstein, referred to as Jane Doe, to assist with her claim in the Epstein Victim Compensation Program or potential litigation.

persons.name: Bradley J. Edwards
persons.context: Attorney at Edwards Pottinger LLC who is a signatory on the formal Touhy request letter seeking evidence for Jane Doe, a victim of Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Seth M. Lehrman
persons.context: Attorney at Edwards Pottinger LLC listed on the letterhead of the formal Touhy request.

persons.context: Attorney at Edwards Pottinger LLC who is a signatory on the formal Touhy request letter seeking evidence for Jane Doe.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman

persons.name: J. Stanley Pottinger
persons.context: Attorney at Edwards Pottinger LLC listed on the letterhead of the formal Touhy request.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased financier accused of sexual abuse; the request seeks evidence of his interactions with and gifts to the victim, Jane Doe.

persons.name: Jane Doe
persons.context: An unnamed victim of Jeffrey Epstein for whom the law firm is seeking documentary evidence from the government to support her claim in the compensation program or litigation.

connections.description: Edwards is an attorney representing Jane Doe, as evidenced by the formal legal request made on her behalf.
Henderson is an attorney representing Jane Doe, as evidenced by the formal legal request made on her behalf.
The document states Jane Doe is one of Jeffrey Epstein's many victims, and the request seeks evidence of his correspondence and gifts to her.
Both are attorneys at the same law firm, Edwards Pottinger LLC, and are co-signatories on the legal request.

events.title: Formal Touhy Request Submission
events.description: The law firm Edwards Pottinger LLC submits a formal written Touhy request to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York for evidence related to Jane Doe, a victim of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Establishment of Epstein Victim Compensation Program
events.description: The document references that the Epstein Victim Compensation Program is currently underway, which is the reason Jane Doe seeks the requested evidence to submit her claim.

locations: New York Office (of Edwards Pottinger LLC)
keyFacts: The document is a formal Touhy request (28 C.F.R. ยง 16.21 et seq.) from victim Jane Doe's attorneys to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
The request seeks nine categories of documentary evidence in the government's possession related to Jane Doe's abuse by Jeffrey Epstein, including photos, videos, correspondence, and gift records.
The stated purpose is to assist Jane Doe in submitting a claim to the ongoing Epstein Victim Compensation Program or, if necessary, proceeding with formal litigation.
The request explicitly states it does not seek classified information, informant identities, or investigatory records that would interfere with ongoing law enforcement proceedings.
